006
007package renderer.scene.primitives;
008
009/**
010   A {@code TriangleStrip} object has {@code n+2} integers that
011   represent the vertices of {@code n} contiguous triangles and
012   another {@code n+2} integers that represent the
013   {@link java.awt.Color} at each of those vertices.
014<p>
015   The integers are indices into the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and
016   {@link java.awt.Color} lists of a {@link renderer.scene.Model} object.
017<p>
018   See
019     <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triangle_strip" target="_top">
020              https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triangle_strip</a>
021*/
022public class TriangleStrip extends OrientablePrimitive
023{
024   /**
025      Construct a {@code TriangleStrip} with the given array of indices for
026      the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and {@link java.awt.Color} index lists.
027      <p>
028      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
029      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
030      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
031      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
032      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
033
034      @param indices  array of vertex and color indices to place in this {@code TriangleStrip}
035   */
036   public TriangleStrip(int... indices)
037   {
038      super(indices);
039   }
040
041
042   /**
043      For debugging.
044
045      @return {@link String} representation of this {@code TriangleStrip} object
046   */
047   @Override
048   public String toString()
049   {
050      String result =  "TriangleStrip: ([";
051      for (int i = 0; i < vIndexList.size() - 1; i++)
052      {
053         result += vIndexList.get(i) + ", ";
054      }
055      result += vIndexList.get(vIndexList.size() - 1) + "], [";
056      for (int i = 0; i < cIndexList.size() - 1; i++)
057      {
058         result += cIndexList.get(i) + ", ";
059      }
060      result += cIndexList.get(cIndexList.size() - 1) + "], [";
061      for (int i = 0; i < cIndexList2.size() - 1; i++)
062      {
063         result += cIndexList2.get(i) + ", ";
064      }
065      result += cIndexList2.get(cIndexList2.size() - 1) + "])";
066      return result;
067   }
068}
